abstract: Severing an exclusive deal with the warehouse retailer has swiped some $8 billion in market value from the card company. Gains at MasterCard and Visa offset only part of that, note Rob Cox and Stephanie Rogan of Reuters Breakingviews.
snippet: Severing an exclusive deal with the warehouse retailer has swiped some $8 billion in market value from the card company. Gains at MasterCard and Visa offset only part of that, note Rob Cox and Stephanie Rogan of Reuters Breakingviews.
lead_paragraph: True to form, Costco customers may come out ahead in a valuable commercial arrangement. That’s at least one way to read the market tea leaves from this week’s divorce between the warehouse retailer and American Express, its longtime exclusive payments partner.

headline.main: Costco Customers May Come Out Ahead in Amex Divorce

byline.original: By Rob Cox and Stephanie Rogan
